tuv.seg: • Introduction • Qualifying for a student grant
• Ag cáiliú do dheontas do mhac léinn
• How to apply • Where to apply
• Conas iarratas a dhéanamh
• Approved courses and institutions
• Cá háit a ndéanfaidh mé iarratas?
The student grant scheme is the main financial support for students
Is í an scéim deontas mac léinn an phríomhthacaíocht airgeadais do mhic léinn
The scheme is governed by legislation made under the Student Support Act 2011
Tá an scéim rialaithe ag an reachtaíocht a dhéantar faoin Acht um Thacaíocht do Mhic Léinn, 2011
Student grants are divided into maintenance grants, fee grants and the postgraduate contribution
Tá deontais mhac léinn roinnte ina ndeontais chothabhála, deontais táillí agus an ranníocaíocht mhac léinn iarchéime
This document only deals with undergraduates
Ní dhéileáiltear sa cháipéis seo ach le fochéimithe
Postgraduates can get information about financial assistance in our document, Postgraduate student grants
Féadfaidh iarchéimithe faisnéis a fháil faoi chúnamh airgeadais inár gcáipéis, deontais mhac léinn iarchéime
Since 1 September 2015, school leavers who have been in the asylum protection system for 5 years and meet certain criteria can apply for student supports under the Pilot Student Support Scheme

Ón 1 Meán Fómhair 2015 ar aghaidh, féadfaidh fágóirí scoile a bhíonn sa chóras cosanta tearmainn ar feadh 5 bliana agus a shásaíonn critéir áirithe iarratas a dhéanamh ar thacaíochtaí mac léinn faoin Scéim Tacaíochta Mac Léinn Píolóta

Other financial supports to students: There is detailed information on the range of grants and funds for students in further and higher education on the website studentfinance.ie for example it has details of the Fund for Students with Disabilities, the Student Assistance Fund and some third-level scholarships

Tacaíochtaí eile airgeadais do mhic léinn: Tá faisnéis mhionsonraithe ann ar an réimse deontas agus cistí atá ann do mhic léinn i mbreisoideachas agus in ardoideachas ar an láithreán gréasáin studentfinance.ie, mar shampla, tá sonraí ann ar an gCiste do Mhic Léinn atá faoi Mhíchumas, an Ciste um Chúnamh Mac Léinn agus roinnt scoláireachtaí tríú leibhéal
A maintenance grant is a contribution towards the student’s living costs
Is ranníocaíocht do chostais maireachtála an mhic léinn atá sa deontas cothabhála
Students who started or are starting courses from the academic year 2010-2011 onward do not qualify for a maintenance grant if they are on a Back to Education Allowance or VTOS allowance
Ní cháilíonn mic léinn a thosaigh nó atá ag tosú ar chúrsaí ón mbliain acadúil 2010-2011 ar aghaidh le haghaidh deontais cothabhála má tá siad ag fáil Liúntas um Filleadh ar Oideachas nó Liúntas VTOS
Maintenance grants are available for approved courses below graduate level in Ireland and other EU states

Tá deontais chothabhála ar fáil do chúrsaí formheasta atá níos ísle ná leibhéal na céime in Éirinn agus stáit eile de chuid an AE agus do chúrsaí iarchéime formheasta in Éirinn agus i dTuaisceart Éirinn
A fee grant can cover any of the following 3 elements:
Is féidir le deontais táillí aon cheann de na heilimintí seo a leanas a chlúdach:
• All or part of the student contribution
• Táillí teagaisc ar fad nó cuid dóibh
• Costs of essential field trips
• Cuid de ranníocaíocht an mhic léinn nó í ar fad
• All or part of a student’s tuition fees (unless covered by the Free Fees Scheme)
• Na costais a bhaineann le turais páirce riachtanacha (mura gcuimsítear iad faoin Scéim um Tháillí Saor in Aisce)
In general, if you qualify for a maintenance grant you will qualify for all elements of the fee grant
Go ginearálta, má tá tú i dteideal deontais cothabhála beidh tú i dteideal gach eilimint den deontas táillí
However, you will not get the tuition element of a fee grant if you already qualify for free tuition under the Free Fees Schemes
Ach ní bhfaighidh tú an chuid teagaisc de dheontas táillí má tá tú i dteideal teagaisc shaor in aisce faoi na Scéimeanna um Tháillí Shaor in Aisce
You may qualify for a fee grant, but not a maintenance grant, if you are a 'tuition student' under the Student Grant Scheme
D’fhéadfá cáiliú do dheontas táillí, seachas do dheontas cothabhála, más mac léinn thú ar a nglaoitear ‘mac léinn teagaisc’ faoi Scéim Deontais na Mac Léinn
A tuition student is someone who fulfils all the conditions for a student grant except for residence in the State, but who has been resident in an EEA state or Switzerland for 3 of the last 5 years

Is éard is mac léinn teagaisc ann duine a shásaíonn na coinníollacha uile do dheontas mac léinn seachas cónaí sa Stát, ach ar a raibh cónaí i stát den LEE nó san Eilvéis ar feadh 3 bliana de na 5 bliana dheireanacha
Students doing Post-Leaving Certificate (PLC) courses do not get fee grants, but if you qualify for a maintenance grant you will be exempt from the PLC participant contribution

Ní fhaigheann mic léinn atá ag tabhairt faoi chúrsaí Iar-Ardteistiméireachta (PLC) deontais táillí, ach má cháilítear thú do dheontas cothabhála, beidh tú díolmhaithe ón ranníocaíocht do rannpháirtithe PLC
Fee grants are available for approved courses below graduate level in Ireland
Tá deontais táillí ar fáil do chúrsaí formheasta atá níos ísle ná leibhéal na céime in Éirinn agus do chúrsaí iarchéime formheasta in Éirinn agus i dTuaisceart Éirinn
However, there are no fee grants for courses elsewhere in the EU
Ach, ní aon deontas táillí do chúrsaí i mballstáit eile de chuid an AE
See 'Approved courses and institutions' below for further detail
Féach ‘Cúrsaí agus institiúidí formheasta’ thíos le haghaidh tuilleadh sonraí
Qualifying for a student grant
Ag cáiliú do dheontas do mhac léinn
To qualify for a student grant, you must fulfil the conditions of the scheme as regards:
Chun a bheith i dteideal dheontas mac léinn, ní mór duit coinníollacha na scéime a shásamh i leith:
• Nationality and immigration status
• Náisiúntacht agus stádas inimirce
You must also be attending an approved course in an approved institution – see ‘Approved courses and institutions’ below
Ní mór duit a bheith ag freastal ar chúrsa formheasta in institiúid fhormheasta – féach ‘Cúrsaí formheasta agus institiúidí formheasta’ thíos

There are detailed conditions about the level of the course you are attending; whether you have attended a course at the same level already; and whether the course represents progression from your previous studies

Is coinníollacha cruinn iad seo maidir le leibhéal a chúrsa ar a bhfuil tú ag freastal; más rud é gur fhreastal tú ar chúrsa den leibhéal céanna cheana’ agus más rud é go seasann an cúrsa mar dhul chun cinn ón staidéar atá déanta agat cheana
In general, you will not get a grant for repeating a year or attending a course at a level that does not represent progression from what you have done before
Go ginearálta, ní bhfaighidh tú deontas chun bliain a dhéanamh in athuair nó chun freastal ar chúrsa nach seasann do dhul chun cinn ón méid atá déanta agat cheana
However, second-chance students may be eligible for a grant
Ach, d’fhéadfadh ‘mic léinn dara seans’ a bheith i dteideal deontais
A second-chance student is someone who is aged over 23, did not successfully complete an earlier course and is returning to pursue an approved course after a full break in studies of at least 5 years
Is éard is ‘mac léinn dara seans’ ann ná duine atá níos sine ná 23 bliain, nár chríochnaigh cúrsa go rathúil cheana agus atá ag filleadh ar chúrsa formheasta tar éis 5 bliana ar a laghad
If you qualify for a maintenance grant, you will qualify for all relevant elements of a fee grant
Má tá tú i dteideal deontais cothabhála beidh tú i dteideal gach eilimint chuí den deontas táillí
You may qualify for a fee grant, but not a maintenance grant, if you are what is called a tuition student under the Student Grant Scheme
D’fhéadfá cáiliú do dheontais táillí, seachas deontas cothabhála, más mac léinn thú ar a nglaoitear ‘mac léinn teagaisc’ faoi Scéim Deontais na Mac Léinn
A tuition student is someone who fulfils all the conditions for a student grant except for residence in the State, but who has been resident in an EEA state or Switzerland for 3 of the last 5 years

Is éard is mac léinn teagaisc ann duine a shásaíonn na coinníollacha uile do dheontas mac léinn seachas cónaí sa Stát, ach ar a raibh cónaí i stát den LEE nó san Eilvéis ar feadh 3 bliana de na 5 bliana dheireanacha
Nationality and immigration status
Náisiúntacht agus stádas inimirce
In order to get a student grant you must be a national of an EEA member state or Switzerland or have immigration status or leave to remain which is one of the following:

Chun deontas mac léinn a fháil, ní mór duit bheith i do náisiúnach de bhallstát den LEE nó den Eilvéis nó stádas inimirce nó cead a bheith agat chun fanacht, agus ceann amháin de na ceanglais a leanas a chomhlíonadh:

• Family member of one of the above, with permission to remain in the State as a family member of such person under the European Communities (Free Movement of Persons) Regulations 2015 and EU Treaty rights provisions

• Bheith i do dhuine muinteartha le duine de na daoine thuas, a bhfuil cead agat chun fanacht sa Stát mar dhuine muinteartha an duine sin faoi fhorálacha Rialacháin na gComhphobal Eorpach (Saorghluaiseacht Daoine), 2006 agus 2008 agus cearta Conartha an AE
• Humanitarian leave to remain in the State before the Immigration Act 1999 came into effect
• Cead daonnúil a bheith agat chun fanacht sa Stát sular tháinig an tAcht Inimirce, 1999 i bhfeidhm
Foreign nationals granted leave to remain under the Irish Born Child scheme - IBC/05 are not eligible
Níl náisiúnaigh iasachta ar deonaíodh cead dóibh fanacht faoin scéim um Leanaí a Rugadh in Éirinn – LRÉ/05 incháilithe
• Permission to reside in the State under the European Union (Subsidiary Protection) Regulations 2013
• Cead a bheith agat chun fanacht sa Stát faoi Rialacháin an Aontais Eorpaigh (Cosaint Choimhdeach), 2013
• Permission to remain following a determination not to make a deportation order
• Cead a bheith agat chun fanacht i ndiaidh go ndearnadh cinntiúchán gan ordú díbeartha a dhéanamh
• Permission to remain in the State by virtue of marriage to, or civil partnership with, an Irish national living here or be the dependent child of a person with such permission
• Cead chun fanacht sa Stát de bhua pósta le, nó páirtnéireacht shibhialta le, náisiúnach Éireannach a chónaíonn anseo nó bheith mar leanbh cleithiúnach duine ag a bhfuil an cead sin
You must have been ordinarily resident in the State for 3 of the previous 5 years to qualify for a maintenance grant
Ní mór go raibh gnáthchónaí ort sa Stát ar feadh 3 bliana le 5 bliana anuas chun cáiliú do dheontas cothabhála
However, if you are studying elsewhere in the EU for a recognised qualification, and you were resident in the State for 3 of the 5 years before starting that course, you satisfy this requirement
Áfach, má dhéanann tú staidéar ar cháilíocht aitheanta in áit eile san AE agus bhí tú i do chónaí sa Stát ar feadh 3 bliana as na 5 bliana roimh thús an chúrsa, tá an coinníoll seo sásta
If you fulfil all the criteria for a maintenance grant except for the residence condition in the State, you may still qualify for a fee grant or a postgraduate fee contribution as a tuition student
Má shásaíonn tú na critéir do dheontas cothabhála seachas don choinníoll um chónaí sa Stát, d’fhéadfaí thú a cháiliú do dheontas táillí fós féin mar ‘mhac léinn teagaisc’

A tuition student is someone who fulfils all the conditions for a student grant except for residence in the State, but who has been resident in an EEA state or Switzerland for 3 of the last 5 years.The members of the EEA (the European Economic Area) are the member states of the EU, along with Iceland, Norway and Liechtenstein

Is éard is mac léinn teagaisc ann duine a shásaíonn na coinníollacha uile do dheontas mac léinn seachas cónaí sa Stát, ach ar a raibh cónaí i stát den LEE nó san Eilvéis ar feadh 3 bliana de na 5 bliana dheireanacha. Is iad ballstáit an LEE (an Limistéar Eacnamaíoch Eorpach) na ballstát den AE, mar aon leis an Íoslainn, an Iorua agus Lichtinstéin
The means test for a student grant in 2017-2018 is based on your family's gross income for the previous full tax year (2016)
Bhí an tástáil acmhainne do dheontas mic léinn i 2017-2018 bunaithe ar ollioncam do theaghlaigh ón mbliain cánach iomlán roimhe sin (2016)
However, if you or your family have had a change of circumstances (which is likely to be permanent) since 31 December 2016, your changed circumstances may be taken into account
Ach, más rud é gur athraigh do chúinsí nó cúinsí do theaghlaigh (agus más dóchúil go bhfuil an t-athrú sin buan) ó 31 Nollaig 2016, d’fhéadfadh do chúinsí athraithe a bheith tógtha san áireamh
Reckonable income for a student grant is gross income from all sources
Is ea ioncam inríofa le haghaidh deontas do mhic léinn ollioncam ó gach foinse eile

Some social welfare payments are excluded from 'reckonable income' for the purposes of student grants - see more details on reckonable income on susi.ie and also in the Student Grant Scheme 2017 (pdf)

Tá íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh áirithe eisiata ó ‘ioncam inríofa’ ar mhaithe le deontais chothabhála – féach tuilleadh eolais ar ioncam inríofa ar susi.ie agus sa Scéim um Dheontas do Mhic Léinn 2017

If you were ordinarily resident with your parents from October 1 of the year before the year of entry to the course, you are considered dependent on your parents and your income (if any) is assessed together with your parents' income(s)

Pléitear leat mar chleithiúnach má bhí tú i do chónaí le do thuismitheoirí ó 1 Deireadh Fómhair na bliana roimh tosach an chúrsa agus meastar aon ioncaim atá agat in éineacht le ioncam do thuismitheoirí
An allowance is made for your earnings outside of term-time – up to €4,500
Tá tuillimh ó fhostaíocht lasmuigh den am téarma ceadaithe suas go €4,500
Outside term time is 2 weeks at Christmas, 2 weeks at Easter and 12 weeks during the summer months of June, July and August only
Ní hionann an t-achar lasmuigh den bhliain acadúil ach amháin coícís ag an Nollaig, coící ag an gCáisc agus 12 seachtain i rith mhíonna an tsamhraidh sa Mheitheamh, Iúil agus Lúnasa
(Holiday pay earned outside these periods may also be allowed by the grant awarding authority on receipt of a letter from the school/college confirming the exact dates of term)
(D’fhéadfadh go gceadódh an t-údarás bronnta deontais pá saoire a tuilleadh lasmuigh de na tréimhsí seo, chomh maith, i ndiaidh litir a fháil ón scoil/gcoláiste a dheimhníonn dátaí cruinne an téarma)
Independent mature candidates are candidates aged 23 or over on 1 January in the year of entry to the course
Is iarrthóirí lánfhásta neamhspleácha iad na hiarrthóirí os cionn 23 bliana d'aois nach bhfuil ina gcónaí lena dtuismitheoirí ón 1 Deireadh Fómhair na bliana roimh bhliain an iarratais
To be assessed as an independent mature candidate you must also live separately from your parents from 1 October of the year before the year of entry to the course
Más mac léinn neamhspleách thú déantar thú a mheasúnú de réir d'ioncaim féin (agus de réir ioncaim do chéile, pháirtnéir sibhialta nó chomhchónaitheoir)
The only points at which you can be reclassified from a dependent student to an independent student are when you:
Ní féidir leat athaicmiú ó mhac léinn cleithiúnach go dtí mac léinn neamhspleách ach amháin má:
• Progress from further education to higher education or
• Tá tú ag dul chun cinn ó oideachas leanúnach go hardoideachas nó
• Have a 3 year break in your studies or
• Tá briseadh 3 bhliain i do staidéar agat nó
• Are returning as a second-chance student after a 5 year break in your studies
• Filleann tú mar mhac léinn dara seans tar éis briseadh 5 bliain i do staidéar
Income limits for maintenance grant and full fee grant
Teorainneacha ioncaim ar mhaithe le deontas cothabhála agus táille
The family income limits for eligibility for a maintenance grant in 2017-2018 are set out below
Tá na teorainneacha ioncaim ar mhaithe le deontas cothabhála i 2017-2018 leagtha amach sa tábla thíos
These income limits are applied after your means are assessed - see 'Means test' above
Baineann na teorainneacha ioncaim seo leat tar éis go meastar d’acmhainní - féach ‘tástáil mhaoine’ thíos
The income limits also apply to the fee grant (that is, if you don't qualify for the free fees scheme and are eligible for a fee grant)
Is féidir leat bheith cáilithe le haghaidh na teorainneacha seo ar mhaithe le deontas táille freisin (má tá tú i dteideal)
Number of dependent children Full maintenance Part maintenance (75%) Part maintenance (50%) Part maintenance (25%)
│Líon na leanaí cleithiúnacha │Deontas iomlán cothabhála │Deontas laghdaithe cothabhála (75%) │Deontas laghdaithe cothabhála (50%) │Deontas laghdaithe cothabhála (25%) │
Income limits for partial fee grant
Teorainneacha ioncaim do dheontas páirt-táille
The family income limits for eligibility for a partial fee grant in 2017-2018 are set out below
Tá na teorainneacha ioncaim teaghlaigh chun a bheith i dteideal deontais pháirt-táille sa bhliain 2017-2018 leagtha amach thíos
Number of dependent children 50% tuition fees and 100% student contribution 50% student contribution only
│Líon na bpáistí cleithiúnacha │50% táillí teagaisc agus 100% ranníocaíocht an mhic léinn │50% ranníocaíocht an mhic léinn amháin │
The 50% tuition fee is not payable if your fees are covered under the Free Fees Scheme
Níl an 50% le h-íoc má íoctar na táillí cheana féin tríd an Tionscnamh Saor ó Tháillí
Other family members in college
Baill eile den teaghlach ag freastal ar choláiste
The reckonable income limits may be increased as follows for each additional family member who is pursuing a full-time course of at least one year’s duration:
Má tá ball eile den teaghlach ag freastal ar chúrsa lánáimseartha ar feadh bliain amháin ar a laghad, d'fhéadfaí na teorainneacha ioncaim a ardú mar a leanas
• In full maintenance and partial fee grant categoriesby €4,830
• Deontas iomlán cothabhála agus deontas pháirt-táille: €4,830
• In part maintenance 75%, 50% and 25% categoriesby €4,670
• Deontas laghdaithe cothabhála 75%, 50%, 25%: €4,670
If you are an independent applicant, the family member taken into account is your spouse, civil partner or cohabitant
Más iarratasóir neamhspleách thú, is é an ball teaghlaigh a thógtar san áireamh ná do chéile, do pháirtí sibhialta nó do chomhchónaitheoir
If you are dependent on your parents, the family members taken into account are your parent(s) and their other dependent children
Má tá tú ag brath ar do thuismitheoirí, is iad na baill teaghlaigh a thógtar san áireamh ná do thuismitheoir(í) agus páistí cleithiúnacha eile
Special rates of grants for disadvantaged students
Deontais bhreise do mhic léinn faoi mhíbhuntáiste
Disadvantaged students who meet a number of conditions can qualify for a special rate of maintenance grant
Is féidir le mac léinn faoi mhíbhuntáiste atá in ann coinníollacha áirid a shásamh deontas breise a fháil

Applicants must have qualified for the standard maintenance grant for the academic year 2017-2018 and total reckonable income in the tax year January to December 2016 must not be more than €23,000, not including Qualified Child Increases and standard exclusions

Ní mór do na hiarrthóirí a bheith i dteideal an ghnáthdheontais chothabhála don bhliain acadúil 2017-2018 agus ní féidir lena n-ioncam measta don bhliain chánach Eanáir–Nollaig 2016 a bheith ós cionn €23,000 glan ar Mhéadú do Leanbh Cáilithe agus na gnáthíocaíochtaí eile a ndéantar neamhaird orthu
For students, including mature students, who are assessed on parent(s)/guardian's income, their parent(s)/guardian must, on 31 December 2016, have been:
Má tá mic léinn, mic léinn aibí san áireamh, measta ar ioncam a dtuismitheoirí/a gcaomhnóirí ní mór go raibh siad siúd ar an 31 Nollaig 2016 ag déanamh éilimh ar:
• Claiming long-term social welfare payments, or
• Íocaíochtaí fadtéarmacha leasa shóisialaigh, nó
• Claiming Family Income Supplement or
• Forlíonadh Ioncaim Teaghlaigh, nó
• Participating in designated programmes (for example, a Community Employment Scheme)
• Ag glacadh páirte i gcláracha ainmnithe (mar shampla,Scéim Fhostaíochta Pobail)
These payments and programmes are listed in Schedule 2 of the Student Grant Scheme 2017 (pdf)
Tá na híocaíochtaí agus cláir liostaithe sa Sceideal 2 na Scéime um Dheontais do Mhic Léinn 2017
For students who are assessed on their own income, on 31 December 2016 the student must have been getting one of these social welfare payments or participating in a designated programme
Má tá mic léinn measta ar a n-ioncam féin, ní mór go raibh siad ar an 31 Nollaig 2016 ag fáil aon cheann de na híocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh a luaitear thuas, nó ag glacadh páirte i gclár ainmnithe
Changes in grant rates take effect in January each year
Tagann athruithe ar na rátaí deontas i bhfeidhm i mí Eanáir gach bliain
Maintenance grant rates for 2017/2018
Is iad seo rátaí an deontais chothabhála don bhliain 2017/2018:
│Type │Non-adjacent rate │Adjacent rate │
│Rátaí │Ráta neamh-chóngarach │Ráta cóngarach │
│Special rate │€5,915 │€2,375 │
│Ráta speisialta │€5,915 │€2,375 │
│Full Maintenance │€3,025 │€1,215 │
│Cothabháil iomlán │€3,025 │€1,215 │
│Part maintenance (75%) │€2,270 │€910 │
│Cothabháil laghdaithe (75%) │€2,270 │€910 │
│Part maintenance (50%) │€1,515 │€605 │
│Cothabháil laghdaithe (50%) │€1,515 │€605 │
│Part maintenance (25%) │€755 │€305 │
│Cothabháil laghdaithe (25%) │€755 │€305 │
Adjacent and non-adjacent rates
Rátaí cóngaracha agus neamh-chóngaracha
For students who live 45 kilometres or less from the college being attended, the adjacent rate of maintenance grant is payable
Íoctaí an ráta cóngarach don deontas cothabhála má bhí cónaí ar an mac léinn 45 ciliméadar nó níos lú ón gcoláiste a bhfuil sé ag freastal air
This rate applies to all students living within this distance, including all mature students, both dependent and independent
Baineann an ráta seo le mic léinn a bhfuil cónaí laistigh den achar seo orthu, mic léinn aibí (cleithiúnach nó neamh-chleithiúnach) san áireamh
The non-adjacent rate applies to everyone else
Baineann an ráta neamh-chóngarach le gach duine eile
From 3 April 2017, you can apply for a student grant for the 2017/2018 academic year
Ón 3 Aibreán 2017 amach, is féidir iarratas a dhéanamh ar dheontas mac léinn i leith na bliana acadúla 2017/2018
Since 2012, Student Universal Support Ireland (SUSI) is the single grant-awarding authority handling all new applications for student grants
Ó 2012 i leith, is í Tacaíocht Chomhchoiteann do Mhic Léinn in Éirinn (SUSI) an t-údarás aonair bronnta deontais a láimhseálann gach iarratas nua ar dheontais mhac léinn
All new grant applications will be made online
Déanfar an uile iarratas nua ar dheontas ar líne
You do not need to know the exact course you will be attending in order to apply online
Ní gá a fhios a bheith agat cé'n cúrsa a mbeidh tú ag freastal air, sula ndéanann tú d'iarratas ar dheontas
You can get information about applying online for a student grant for the 2017-2018 academic year
Is féidir leat iarratas a dhéanamh ar líne do dheontas i leith na bliana 2016-2017
You will need your Personal Public Service Number (PPSN) and an email address and phone number to apply online
Is gá duit d’Uimhir Phearsanta Seirbhíse Poiblí, uimhir bailí teileafóin agus seoladh ríomhphoist chun iarratas ar líne a dhéanamh
The closing date for receipt of student grant applications for the 2017-2018 academic year is 13 July 2017
Sé an dáta deiridh i gcomhair iarratais ar dheontas mic léinn le haghaidh na bliana acadúil 2017-2018 ná an 13 Iúil 2016
SUSI's helpdesk is handling email and telephone queries - see 'Where to apply' below
Tá deasc cabhrach SUSI ag déileáil le ceisteanna cheana féin, trí ríomhphost agus ar an dteileafón - féach 'Cá háit a dhéanfaidh mé iarratas' thíos
Renewals of existing grants will be handled by the authority that issued them initially
I gcás athnuachan deontais reatha, leanfaidh an t-údarás a d'eisigh an deontas cheana ar aghaidh ag déileáil leo
Student grants are reviewed each year
Déantar athbhreithniú ar dheontas do mhic léinn gach bliain

If you had a grant in one academic year and are continuing your studies on the course in the following year, the body that awarded the grant will be in contact with you in order to renew or re-assess your student grant for that next year

Más rud é go raibh deontas agat in bliain acadúil amháin agus má tá tú ag leanúint ar aghaidh le do chuid staidéir ar an gcúrsa sa bhliain ina dhiadh sin, déanfaidh an comhlacht a d' íoc do dheontas teagmháil leat chun athnuachan nó athmheasúnú a dhéanamh ar do dheontas do mhic léinn don bhliain eile

If you are considered eligible on initial assessment of your application, you will get a provisional grant approval in the post and a personalised list of the supporting documents that you need to provide

Má mheastar gur incháilithe thú tar éis measúnú tosaigh a dhéanamh ar d’iarratas, gheobhaidh tú ceadú sealadach deontais sa phost mar aon le liosta pearsantaithe de na doiciméid tacaíochta is gá duit a sholáthar
You should send the necessary documents (photocopies, not originals) as soon as possible in the envelope supplied
Ba cheart duit na doiciméid riachtanacha (fotachóipeanna seachas bunchóipeanna) a sheoladh ar aghaidh a luaithe agus is féidir sa chlúdach litreach a chuirtear ar fáil
SUSI will then process your application to award stage, subject to confirmation of your acceptance on an approved course
Déanfaidh SUSI d’iarratas a phróiseáil ansin chuig céim an cháiliúcháin, faoi réir deimhniú go nglacfaidh tú le háit ar chúrsa ceadaithe
If you think that you have been unjustly refused a grant, you may appeal by writing to the organisation you applied to
Más dóigh leat gur diúltaíodh deontas duit go héagórach, is féidir leat achomharc a dhéanamh i scríbhinn chuig an eagraíocht ar chuir tú isteach orthu
You must appeal within 30 days of getting your decision
Ní mór duit achomharc a dhéanamh laistigh de 30 lá tar éis do chinneadh a fháil
If your appeal is turned down, and you feel that the conditions have not been interpreted correctly, you can make a further appeal
Má dhiúltaítear d’achomharc, agus má bhraitheann tú nár baineadh an chiall ba cheart as na coinníollacha, is féidir leat achomharc breise a dhéanamh
If you are not satisfied with the decision from an appeals officer in a grant-awarding authority you can make a further appeal to the Student Grants Appeals Board

Má bheidh tú ag tosú nó ag bogadh go dtí cúrsa nua ó 2011 ar aghaidh, ba cheart duit an t-achomharc breise seo a sheoladh, laistigh de 30 lá tar éis do chinneadh a fháil, go dtí an Bord Achomhairc um Dheontais Mhic Léinn, a bunaíodh faoin Acht um Thacaíocht do Mhic Léinn, 2011
You should submit your appeal online to the Student Grants Appeals Board
Comhlánaigh an fhoirm ‘Fógra Achomhairc leis an mBord Achomharc um Dheontais do Mhic Léinn’, atá ar fáil ó d’údarás cáiliúcháin deontais
Your appeal must be submitted within 30 days from the date of the letter from the appeals officer in SUSI or the awarding authority

Má tá tú ag leanúint le cúrsa a thosaigh tú roimh 2011, ba cheart duit an t-achomharc breise seo a sheoladh chuig an rannóg do Chothromas Rochtana ar an Ardoideachas den Roinn Oideachais agus Scileanna trí leas a bhaint as an bhfoirm ‘Fógra Achomhairc leis an Aire’, atá ar fáil ó údarás cáiliúcháin an deontais
You can only appeal the outcome of a decision from an appeals officer in a grant-awarding authority to the Student Grants Appeals Board
Níor cheart duit scríobh chuig an mBord Achomharc nó chuig an Roinn Oideachais agus Scileanna más mian leat toradh achomhairc thosaigh a achomharc le húdarás cáiliúcháin an deontais
Student Universal Support Ireland (SUSI)
Tacaíocht Uilíoch do Mhic Léinn, Éire (SUSI)
Approved courses and institutions
Cúrsaí agus institiúidí ceadaithe
In general, the Student Grant Scheme covers all the approved courses and institutions covered by the 4 schemes it replaced. Details of what each scheme covered are below
Go ginearálta, clúdaíonn an Scéim Deontais nua do Mhic Léinn gach cúrsa formheasta agus institiúidí clúdaithe ag na 4 scéim a d’athchuir sé
The approved courses are prescribed in the Student Support Regulations 2017 (pdf)
Tá sonraí maidir leis an méid a chlúdaigh gach scéim ar fáil thíos
The approved institutions are listed in Schedules 1 and 2 of the Regulations
Tá na cúrsaí formheasta leagtha síos i Rialachán 4 de na Rialacháin Tacaíochta do Mhic Léinn 2016 agus tá na hinstitiúidí formheasta liostáilte i Sceidil 1 agus 2 de na Rialacháin
